link.title: Baton Rouge University Preparatory Elementary: News and Announcements

div.p: We are all monitoring developments related to the Novel Coronavirus, known as 2019-nCoV, which was first identified in China. The Centers for Disease Control, or CDC, has determined that the immediate health risk from 2019-nCoV to the general American public is considered low at this time.
div.span:
We are all monitoring developments related to the Novel Coronavirus, known as 2019-nCoV, which was first identified in China. The Centers for Disease Control, or CDC, has determined that the immediate health risk from 2019-nCoV to the general American public is considered low at this time. However, the CDC does recommend the following:
COVER YOUR MOUTH.
Cover your mouth and nose with a tissue or your sleeve when coughing or sneezing. (Covering with your hands will then spread the germs to anything you touch.)
WASH HANDS OFTEN.
Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. If soap and water are not available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer.
WHEN GERMS HIT, STAY HOME.
Students with a fever should remain at home until fever free for at least 24 hours and those exhibiting signs of upper respiratory illness such as continuous coughing, sneezing and/or runny nose are also asked to remain at home until symptoms clear.

div.div: 7802 Howell Boulevard • Baton Rouge, LA 70807 • Phone: (225) 364-9805 • Fax: (225) 286-7491
The road to college starts in kindergarten.
